data.title: George Foley filmography
data.text:
Overview: A Sheffield Blade is a 1918 British silent drama film directed by Joseph Jay Bamberger and Harry T. Roberts and starring George Foley and Jill Willis.

Genre: Drama

A factory owner's son poses as a workman and invents a rustless knife.

Overview: The Grip of Iron is a 1920 British silent crime film directed by Bert Haldane and starring George Foley, Malvina Longfellow and James Lindsay. It was based on a play of the same title by Arthur Shirley ...

Genre: Crime

Director: Bert Haldane

In Paris a lawyer's clerk is the secret strangler who robs for an extravagant daughter's sake.

Overview: The Battle of Waterloo is a 1913 feature film created by British and Colonial Films to dramatize the eponymous battle ahead of its centenary. The Battle of Waterloo was much longer and more costly than ...

Overview: The Ticket-of-Leave Man is a 1918 British silent crime film directed by Bert Haldane and starring Daphne Glenne, George Foley and Aubrey Fitzmaurice. It is an adaptation of the 1863 melodrama The Tick ...

Genre: Crime, Drama

Director: Bert Haldane

Writer: Tom Taylor

A framed man is released from prison and uncovers a burglary plot.

Overview: The Flat is a 1921 British silent drama film directed by Fred Paul and starring Jack Raymond and George Foley. Its plot involves a man who is invited back to a flat for a drink by a stranger he meets in ...

Overview: The Snare is a 1918 British silent romance film directed by Frank Wilson and starring Violet Hopson, George Foley and Trevor Bland. The screenplay concerns a woman marries a millionaire who likes to go ...

Genre: Romance, Drama

Director: Frank Wilson

Producer: Walter West

A socialite weds a poaching millionaire and learns to love him.

Overview: The Answer is a 1916 British silent drama film directed by Walter West and starring Muriel Martin-Harvey, George Foley and Dora Barton. It was based on a novel by Newman Flower.

Genre: Drama

Director: Walter West

A spirit shows a bankrupt three stories of faith overcoming distress.

Overview: A Munition Girl's Romance is a 1917 British silent thriller film directed by Frank Wilson and starring Violet Hopson, Gregory Scott and George Foley. The screenplay concerns a young woman from a wealthy ...

Genre: Drama, Crime

Director: Frank Wilson

Producer: Walter West

Writer: Charles Barnett

A bart's daughter working as a munitionette helps a designer save plans from a spying foreman.

Overview: Because is a 1918 British silent drama film directed by Sidney Morgan and starring Lilian Braithwaite, Ben Webster and George Foley. A father locks his daughter up when she refuses to marry the man he ...

Overview: A Gamble for Love is a 1917 British silent sports film directed by Frank Wilson and starring Gerald Ames, James Lindsay and George Foley. It was based on a novel of the same title by Nat Gould, set in ...

Genre: Drama, Sport

Director: Frank Wilson

Producer: Walter West

A Lord tries to hobble a rich widow's horse which she wagers against her lover's

Overview: The Woman Who Did is a 1915 British silent drama film directed by Walter West and starring Eve Balfour, Thomas H. MacDonald and George Foley. It was adapted from the 1895 novel The Woman Who Did by Grant ...

Overview: A Couple of Down and Outs is a 1923 British silent drama film directed by Walter Summers and starring Edna Best, Rex Davis and George Foley.

Director: Walter Summers

Writer: Walter Summers

An ex-soldier steals his horse to save it from the battlefield, and becomes a tramp.
